website_summaries.verdict: Sony's Digital Paper DPT-RP1 offers an easy way to read and mark up big stacks of large-format digital documents.
pros: Comes with stylus for marking up documents
cons: Stylus is laggy, lacks pressure sensitivity

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for a few months...now it's a brick
customer_reviews.text: I ordered here and got it and it was fine for a few months. I did nothing differently, used same cord and computer...and all of a sudden it's a brick. Won't charge. Apparently several others have had the same problem (on Sony site) and Sony won't even respond to them. $700 wasted. DO NOT BUY--HAVE TWEETED AND CALLED SONY DIGITAL SUPPORT SINCE I AM STILL UNDER WARRANTY--NO HELP! AMAZON WON'T RESPOND EITHER. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: LAG

customer_reviews.title: Beats the Remarkable
customer_reviews.text: My use case for the DPT-RP1 is academic; research papers, company reports, etc. . I ordered both the Sony Digital Paper and the Remarkable. I returned the Remarkable. The key advantages of the Sony are: view two documents side-by-side; have a digital notepad displayed beside a PDF to record notes on (or solve a pset); no need for a wifi connection to sync documents (can be done via wifi, bluetooth, or cable); more reliable software suite; erase/highlight quickly via dedicated buttons on the pen instead of having to switch tools via a multi-step process. The Remarkable has two advantages: slightly better writing experience (Remarkable: 9/10 ; Sony: 8/10), buttons so you need not touch the screen with your hands (fingerprints).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working After Two Years
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it suddenly stopped responding to any touch out of the blue (becoming useless) after two years of gentle use. I spoke with Sony and they are aware of the issue as it is happening with a lot of customers after a couple years. They unfortunately aren't willing to offer any extended warranty coverage for this known issue. I tried the recommended software reset multiple times without any luck so it must be a faulty hardware issue. I used to recommended this product, but certainly can't anymore. $700 is way too much to pay for something that is known to breakdown after a couple years. Truly unfortunate because it was great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: GMK

customer_reviews.title: Cool Tech, but not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pro: - The digital ink screen looks fantastic, and the device is light. - The screen makes it really comfortable for reading. Cons: - The device looks kind of cheap, the build quality doesn't seem worth 700 dollars. - The software is really bad, it always has problems connecting to the digital paper desktop app. - The stylus using experience is far from satisfied
customer_reviews.author: William Yao

customer_reviews.title: Very light. Crack on the edge on the first day.
customer_reviews.text: I got it delivered today. So it might be too early to review it. Anyway this is how I felt about it. I was surprised that it's so thin and light. The screen looks very sleek. It's very responsive. The only problem I found was that it's not seamless like apple products. It seems very fragile. I found a crack on the top edge and fear that it may grow apart. You can see the issue in the picture. I purchased the 3-year protection with it. I hope it will cover it when the crack becomes a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kong

customer_reviews.title: Never buy a Sony again!
customer_reviews.text: In my first order, the top portion of the screen wasn't responsive to any touch of fingers or stylus. I returned it and got a replacement which worked fine for a month and then the top portion became unresponsive again just a few days after the return period ended. I contacted Amazon but it referred me to Sony, to whom I emailed but have never heard from them since then. Worst customer service ever! I used to trust and love Japanese products but after this I would think twice and definitely never buy a Sony product again!
customer_reviews.author: Son Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: If you break the consumable tips in the stylus you are in deep trouble
customer_reviews.text: I dropped the stylus breaking the plastic tip. There is no way to remove the broken tip from the stylus, rendering this $700 tablet unusable. Sony's solution for this problem is to purchase a new stylus every time you drop it and break a consumable tip. A new stylus is nearly $80. This is a serious design flaw and I am going to be forced to return this otherwise wonderful device. If they had an improved stylus with a removable end that would allow the broken tips to be removed I would consider keeping the device, but as it stands this is untenable.
customer_reviews.author: Brent A. Forden

customer_reviews.title: Over priced for a unipurposed device
customer_reviews.text: Notwithstanding Sony made this for a restricted, exclusive market of professional pdf readers/redacters, an individual would have difficulty justifying purchase price to a rational observer. Even half priced is extreme for what you get. Sony can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo York

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service and firmware update
customer_reviews.text: It was okay to use except slow firmware update with necessary function such as selected page move. But right after warranty, I leave one month without use, and my dpt-rp1 does not turn on. After quick charging, it turns on and show “low power” and turned off. And charging led turns off and I keep several hours, and it is not charged. And customer service in US is terrible. There is no customer service center after warranty. I might need to replace battery, but no way. It is terrible expensive junk.
customer_reviews.author: Min Hyung Lee

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is perfect for students and for anyone who uses PDFs extensively
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is perfect for students and for anyone who uses PDFs extensively. I also use it as a personal notebook. This device has replaced many binders filled with paper PDFs as well as paper spiral notebooks. Some people have complained about how to felt tips go out quickly. The key is to not use too much pressure while writing on the device. I haven't used up one felt tip (pencil) yet and I have used this device nearly everyday for about 3 months now.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Emailed Sony and amazon - no reply
customer_reviews.text: Contacted both Amazon and Sony about a fault with this product . Multiple emails - absolute zero reply. The pen left marks which wouldn't go away . So, until I receive a reply, I can only warn potential customers to stay clear. For the price , the level of service does not warrant the purchase. Go for something else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Device does not pair with macbook pro and pen won't charge
customer_reviews.text: I tried to pair using the provided USB cable. Everytime I plugged in the device, the Digital paper app would show "Connecting to Digital paper" for a few seconds and then disappear but the device does not connect at all. I re-initialized the device, reset my macbook, tried different usb-cables, turned of my firewall, did everything written in the helpguide etcetera. I also immediately got the warning that the battery level of my pen was very low. I tried charging it via my computer, but the red light immediately disappeared. I tried different cables, via computer, via AC, re-initialized the device etcetera. Still won't charge. A bit disappointing to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: Martin Schoups

customer_reviews.title: Truly awesome product-
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changing product for me and has dramatically increased my productivity A few advantages: 1. Writes like paper, syncs back to the computer with the annotations (in blue ink), which can then be printed if needed. 2. It doesn't really have any internet connection, so web surfing and checking email and other time wasting activities are out of question 3. Opening two documents side by side is easy. 4. Since it writes like paper, I do not need a separate notebook to write down my thoughts and this has become go to for pretty much every writing.
customer_reviews.author: N12

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. It's useless to me.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of disappointed. I thought it support tap to turn pages. But it doesn't. As a pianist, the speed of page turn by swiping is way too slow. And please support Bluetooth pedal. I don't need a browser, but I need support for Bluetooth pedal or tapping to turn pages.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: This product is only suitable for a small number of people. If it is not used to look at the literature, it is basically useless. It is an electronic product with extremely low cost performance. Other manufacturers will support more formats, but the weight, product appearance, and usage experience will all have different experiences. Sony is cold and unwilling to support formats other than PDF. Simply reading itself, I think this product is still very powerful. Just the price is very unfriendly, and the refill is not cheap, it is difficult to understand, is the cost of this stuff so high?
customer_reviews.author: Amazonconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic PDF reader and editor.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for what it was designed for, reading and editing pdf's. I am a STL in Bible Study Fellowship and anyone familiar with BSF knows that there is a tremendous amount of material accumulated by years end. With the Sony DPT-RP1, this is no longer an issue as all my material is now on this device. The e-ink screen is large, clear, and a joy to read off of. The device is speedy even with huge pdf's. Additionally, by using Calibre, my device has become my goto for reading the news. This will be a much nicer product once the firmware is updated and once the OS is opened up.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I saw some bad comment, but I really love my device, which I’ve used for more than 1 year. It’s super light, so I can carry it with my laptop during travel. The new app on mobile phone makes it super convenient to send online pdf found on mobile phone to my device. The writing function is so so. I like using reading various documents, such as professional books, novels, and even guitar sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow/horrible response
customer_reviews.text: The screen PDF response is extremely slow; it is a torture to read (latest firmware installed) No brightness control; not meant to be used in dim lighting I find myself going back to my iPad Pro for reading.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect to Windows PC via usb

Moreover, I even cannot set up wifi without using USB to connect to my PC first. I read and follow all available guides from the internet, but they helped nothing. I choose the device is because it is efficient and straightforward. Now the developers of the app ruin all of its advantages. For now, I will wait for my new laptop to see if the product will work, even though my desktop and old laptop.

I connected the Sony for the problem 1 but they said that they cannot help except i send it to US from UK again. It's pretty much for delivery fee. After all, it'not a satisfied product.

customer_reviews.title: but the outcome is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: The product has a heart-breaking issue: if your writing hand is in contact with the screen (which is almost inevitable unless writing on the right/left margin, given right/left-handedness), you would observe significantly worsened precision and lags. This makes note-taking while reading papers less pleasant. I'm right-handed, and so far my solution is to take notes on the right side if possible, and if I have to write small words on the left, I use the zoom function. It takes a little bit more time, but the outcome is pretty good.

This is perfect for working with documents and only documents. This has been helpful when completing math formulas and problems. You can neatly organize your work

customer_reviews.title: Transferring files is quite easy except for a bit bugginess in the software but ...

Simplicity is beauty. Transferring files is quite easy except for a bit bugginess in the software but I am sure the devs are working on an upgrade already. Overall, fantastic item for book lovers / people who have to read a lot of PDF documents such as researcher, students, people dealing with markets etc etc.

Really hope this could be much improved.

customer_reviews.title: A superb device for reading PFD

The tip of my Stylus was broken and part of it was stuck inside, there is no way to remove it at all. Luckily, the customer service of Sony is really good. Its staff member Mr. Stephenson, contacted me and provided assistance shortly after they learnt my problem. I really appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: CHAN, SUI LEUNG

customer_reviews.title: Gray background. Too flimsy for travel.
customer_reviews.text: The device is great at the simple functionality of displaying PDFs. It is lightweight, high resolution and simple to use. But, there are many shortcomings. As you can see in the photo, the background is very gray and can be hard to read even in a well-lit room. The device itself is also very thin and doesn’t feel sturdy at all. It’s supposed to be portable, but I’m afraid to put it in my bag even with a case because it might break (something might poke the screen, or it might get bent). Overall, I still like the device for reading at my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: I still find it useful but it could be so much more
customer_reviews.text: This is the prototypical Sony device.. Superb well made, solid elegant hardware.. that is somehow in no other words purposefully restrained in its use by software. How a company introduces a new generation of a device and then strips it of basic functionality is beyond me. I still find it useful but it could be so much more.
customer_reviews.author: doctech

customer_reviews.title: I use the DPT-RP1 everyday at work. It is really an excellent tool to read and take notes.
customer_reviews.text: I am a researcher in a University and this has really a great tool to read papers and annotate them, as well as for taking notes or write different things. Since I have it I use it everyday. I am very disappointed though, that it is only available in the USA and Japan and not in Europe (where I live). There is certainly a big potential market for this device. Everyone that sees my DPT-RP1 is amazed by it and many of them would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristóbal Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Great writing tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful writing tool. Great side by side feature, offers the ability to have PDF on one side to read and review, while you can have a new document to the side to take notes. Easy to transfer PDFs to and from the devices and back up on your desktop computer.

customer_reviews.text: I read reviews before purchase and noticed that many experience issues with the product after a couple of years or so. I thought I can handle it with care to avoid this issue. It turns out that I am the extremely lucky one that the product turned into wood after 2 months only!!! Nothing works now and no one from Amazon or Sony cares about it apparently.

And this $700 thing is useless without a pen. I don't know how much I have to keep spending on the pens... Wouldn't recommend this to anyone anymore...

customer_reviews.title: It's good product, moderate size for use

The most point is that CP1 only accept PDF format doc... It would be better if more format could be accepted..

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea, but needs integration with a bigger cloud ...

customer_reviews.title: best of all time, worst of all time

It is absolutely an amazing piece of technology for those who cannot live without pdfs. If you are among those kinds, then you will be dazzled by its capability and portability. For those who are not super into E-readers, this product would be nothing but mass disappointments. Just get an iPad Pro, if that's what you'll need. In conclusion, this is my dream E-reader, despite its lack of exceptional built quality, and limited software. Do buy it if this is for you.

customer_reviews.title: SONY sent me a used product

customer_reviews.text: Not very useful on a daily work basis. Whenever you wanted to search some articles and scan quickly, you will not like it.

product_meta.title: Sony DPT-RP1/B 13” Digital Paper, Black
product_meta.description: Style:13" Digital Paper| Pattern Name:SingleSony’s digital paper for industries that generate large quantities of documents during routine operations. Professors, researchers in higher education prefer its large screen size which accommodates 8.5” by 11” documents for reading and handwriting. Provided stylus is just like ink or pencil on paper. Read and annotate documents, then share wirelessly via Bluetooth, wifi, or through the provided USB cable. Display Technology - Electrophoretic display
feature_bullets: World's thinnest, lightest letter-size tablet device: as thin as 30 sheets of paper; Wireless Security: WPA2-PSK (AES), 802.1x EAP (TLS/PEAP)
Projected capacitive touchscreen allows for “pencil or pen style” writing and erasing with provided stylus.
Easy drag & drop transfer of documents via USB or wireless (Wi-Fi or Bluetooth) with Digital Paper app installed on your PC or Mac.
High contrast and no glare, so text can be read clearly even in bright sunlight. Battery Life with Wi-Fi On Up to 1 week.Frequency Band 2.4 GHz, 5 GHz Bluetooth: Bluetooth specification Ver4.2
Rechargeable lithium-ion battery provides up to three weeks use on a single charge. 16GB internal memory provides storage for approximately 10,000 PDF files.
